column2: TEXAS DMV TEST

1. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
2. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 3. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column6: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column10: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.

column2: 4. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
5. Most signs used in street work areas are:
6. Green and white signs:
column4: give information about directions and distances.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 7. This warning sign:
column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column10: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column2: 8. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column10: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.

column2: 9. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 10. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities

16. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 17. To enter a freeway:
column4: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column6: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 18. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column4: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: the speed limit on that route.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 24. A red traffic sign means?
25. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
